content: <oai_dc:dc xmlns:oai_dc="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/" xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd"><dc:title>Sato-Tate Problem for GL(3)</dc:title><dc:creator>Zhou, Fan</dc:creator><dc:date>2013</dc:date><dc:type>text</dc:type><dc:subject>Mathematics</dc:subject><dc:identifier>http://hdl.handle.net/10022/AC:P:20048</dc:identifier><dc:description>Based upon the work of Goldfeld and Kontorovich on the Kuznetsov trace formula of Maass forms for SL(3,Z), we prove a weighted vertical equidistribution theorem (with respect to the generalized Sato-Tate measure) for the p-th Hecke eigenvalue of Maass forms, with the rate of convergence. With a conjectured orthogonality relation between the Fourier coefficients of Maass forms for SL(N,Z) for N\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd4, we generalize the above equidistribution theorem to N\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd4.</dc:description><dc:language>English</dc:language></oai_dc:dc>
